column5: What I started with is an old Peterborough 12' aluminum boat, rotted out transom and no motor.    Painted the inside light grey and green. Added new transom on both inside and outside.    Exterior was painted green and dark grey on the bottom    I have bought a motor and trolling motor for it, Ill add more pictures when the entire setup is in the water.
Nice looking tinny.  I rebuilt ours at the cottage 2 years ago, but I got lazy and didn't paint it.  It doesn't take much to make an old tin boat like new again!
Nice job ! Now it will provide fishing opportunities for many years to come.

how are the rivets??  Round and made of aluminium!!!! Great job, the boat looks like new now.  Got a little 12 footer I need to do at some point as well as an old snowmobile. Just have to find the time.
Looks like a million bucks compared to what you started off with!
how are the rivets??  Rivetted?  The boat floats before painting.  Thanks for the replies guys. Ill add more, I have a name coming for it and the motor mounting.
Which paint did you use?  Did you spray it with self etching primer?  Your paint job looks very smooth & shiny.  I'm asking because I am sanding my 14'  Lund getting it ready for paint.  Thanx
Rivetted?  The boat floats before painting.  Thanks for the replies guys. Ill add more, I have a name coming for it and the motor mounting. lol  are they leaking or is everything nice and dry
I used self etching primer. And it's tremclad rust paint.  Rolled on not spray. Two coats.
Wow!  Nice & smooth for a roller!!
